channel.title: How do i edit my client
channel.description: i have an old copy or the rs client but is it posible for me to edit it so that it 1. runs on my website and 2. descises itself so that the rs servers think it is a current client so i can connect with it? and what is the ip for world 63 and/or 64 and my decompiler isnt working properly

item.title: How do i edit my client
item.dc:creator: @person1936 person1936
item.description:
@person1936 wrote:

i still need to know how to make it work on my website[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2007, 06:45:32 PM[/size][hr]and what about rsc 1 and 2

Read full topic
item.source: How do i edit my client

item.title: How do i edit my client
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

you don’t have to decompile a client to edit it,you can use bytecode to get a new client to connect… to get an old client to connect to the new servers, you probably would, but, most of the deobs are already decompiled for you…

Read full topic
item.source: How do i edit my client

item.title: How do i edit my client
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=“speedster239, post:3, topic:165430”]Its possible that you could connect with an older client version to a new client version but you’d need to do alot of bcel work =/

If you want to check out an index of the old client versions visit: http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin/

Fyi current rsversion is 481[/quote]
Well seeing as the packet byte offset changes every client version, you’d have to rip the offset out of the latest client, inject it into the old client, then get it to tell the update server the latestest version…It’s almost impossible, due to the amount of hooks you’d need, and there isn’t really much point in doing this anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i edit my client

item.title: How do i edit my client
item.dc:creator: @person1936 person1936
item.description:
@person1936 wrote:

vbcoderx:

there are plenty of tuts, old clients can’t connect to the new server, this is the wrong section, http://se3.runescape.com/ , http://se4.runescape.com/ , wtf does a decompiler have to do with any of this, and please go back to moparscape

i have to decompile the client to edit it now dont i[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2007, 08:00:15 PM[/size][hr][quote=“speedster239, post:3, topic:165430”]Its possible that you could connect with an older client version to a new client version but you’d need to do alot of bcel work =/

If you want to check out an index of the old client versions visit: http://moparisthebest.com/rs/bin/

Fyi current rsversion is 481[/quote]
back to moparscape i go for the client editing
and ports please
and what does “bcel” mean?

Read full topic

Its possible that you could connect with an older client version to a new client version but you’d need to do alot of bcel work =/

Fyi current rsversion is 481
